ARABIC: إِنَّمَا ٱلسَّبِيلُ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ يَظْلِمُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ وَيَبْغُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ أُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: There are only grounds against those who wrong people and act as tyrants in the earth without any right to do so. Such people will have a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Blame lies on those who oppress, and terrorise the land unjustly. For them there is painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Blame attaches only to those who subject people to wrong and commit excesses on earth. A painful chastisement awaits them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Only those who do injustice to people and commit rebellion on earth for no reason will be questioned. They will suffer a painful torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Reproach is only against those who oppress people, and wrongfully spread rebellion in the land; for them is a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The way is only against those who oppress men and rebel in the earth without justification; for such there will be a painful torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The way (to blame) is only against those who oppress men and revolt in the earth unjustly; these shall have a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: The way is only open against those who do wrong to the people, and are insolent in the earth wrongfully; there awaits them a painful chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The way (of blame) is only against those who oppress mankind, and wrongfully rebel in the earth. For such there is a painful doom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: blame falls only on those who wrong men and transgress on this earth without justification, such will have a painful punishment,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The way of blame is only against those who wrong mankind, and rebel in the earth without justice; these! for them is a torment afflictive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The ground for action is only against those who oppress the people and commit tyranny in the land in violation of justice. For such there will be a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The blame is only against those who oppress men and wrong-doing and insolently transgress beyond bounds through the land, defying right and justice: for such there will be a penalty grievous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The way (of blame) is only against those who oppress men and wrongly rebel in the earth, for such there will be a painful torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The blame is only against those who wrong people, and are wrongfully insolent in the earth, for them there is a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Blame lies on those who wrong people, and commit aggression in the land without right. These will have a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The cause is only against the ones who wrong the people and tyrannize upon the earth without right. Those will have a painful punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [42:42] A course [of action] is only [open] against those who wrong people and seek [to commit], [who] commit, in the earth what is not right, [what are] acts of disobedience. For such there will be a painful chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The way (of blame)) sin (is only against those who oppress mankind) i.e. who initiate wrong in the first place, (and wrongfully rebel in the earth. For such there is a painful doom.
